issue.title: Make substitution an interpretation
issue.body:
Resolves #149 

This refactoring PR makes `substitute` into an interpretation, so that it can reuse the tail-call optimization added in #145 and duplicate code can be removed.  The computations actually done by `substitute` should remain unchanged and the cost should be identical.

Tested: exercised by existing tests, and also longer example runs that started failing after #148.

Tasks:
- [x] Make `substitute` into an interpretation
- [x] Update semantics and implementation of `Independent` to be compatible with this version of `substitute`

Triaged:
- Make tail-call optimization compatible with `funsor.numpy` #1 (added conditional xfail for now)

issue.title: make Tensor backend agnostic
issue.body:
This PR attempts to make Tensor backend agnostic, which will subsume efforts to write non-numeric code for each backend. In principle, we only require adding dispatches to numeric ops for a new backend.

### Tasks

- [x] fork `funsor.torch.Tensor` to a new class `tensor.Tensor` and change all torch ops to funsor.ops

- [x] fork all eager op on `funsor.torch.Tensor` to `tensor.Tensor`

- [x] add tests for the change

- [x] remove unnecessary code in `torch.py`, `numpy.py`; only keep dispatching implementation on those files

- [x] Fix `test_arange_simple`

- [x] Fix a weird bug of at the assertation `assert type(actual) == type(expected)`, where actual and expected are two `Tensor`s with numpy scalar data.

- [x] Update tensor docs

### Future PRs

- add backend-agnostic tests to `test_gaussian`.
- create `torch` and `numpy` folders that hold implementations of dispatching numeric ops and dispatching distributions.

body:
> Enable test_tensor.py with FUNSOR_USE_TCO=1

@fehiepsi this should currently work with PyTorch but not NumPy.  Unless there was a regression in #303 and the PyTorch version is failing too, there's no need to prioritize this.

issue.title: Add numpy backend tests for Gaussian
issue.body:
Follow up  #303, this PR adds numpy backend tests for gaussian.

### Tasks

- [x] fix eager_subs_affine test; currently, the numpy test failed due to torch tensor is created during the process...
- [x] fix integrate tests

body: I'm going to close this as resolved. We can track progress on `normalize` in #411.
